data.scheme_name: Haryana AatmaNirbhar Textile Policy 2022-25 - Support for Obtaining Fire Insurance Policy - Existing
data.benefits: The scheme provides reimbursement of 75% of insurance premium up to a maximum of Rs. 10 lakh per year during the operative period of the policy to all textile MSMEs.
data.eligibility: All existing units engaged in textile activities and any project undertaking expansion/diversification/modernization during the operative period of the policy are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Fire insurance must be procured from an IRDAI-approved agency or company.
  2. Insurance must be taken on or after the policy notification date.
  3. The unit must have URC.
  4. The unit should not be on the State Government's restrictive list.
  5. The unit must obtain CLU/NOC from the Competent Authority if applicable.
  6. The unit should be in commercial production.
  7. The unit must be in regular production at the time of disbursement.
  8. The unit should have installed fire safety equipment and obtained fire safety NOC.
  9. Existing enterprises expanding or diversifying with an investment greater than 25% of their current gross fixed capital investment.
  10. Expansion/diversification must begin during the policy's operative period and be completed within 18 months.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units engaged in textile activities and any project undertaking expansion/diversification/modernization during the operative period of the policy are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Fire insurance must be procured from an IRDAI-approved agency or company.
  2. Insurance must be taken on or after the policy notification date.
  3. The unit must have URC.
  4. The unit should not be on the State Government's restrictive list.
  5. The unit must obtain CLU/NOC from the Competent Authority if applicable.
  6. The unit should be in commercial production.
  7. The unit must be in regular production at the time of disbursement.
  8. The unit should have installed fire safety equipment and obtained fire safety NOC.
  9. Existing enterprises expanding or diversifying with an investment greater than 25% of their current gross fixed capital investment.
  10. Expansion/diversification must begin during the policy's operative period and be completed within 18 months.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: Through this scheme, the Government will provide financial assistance for creating besting-class manufacturing infrastructure, upgradation of technology, promotion of textile products across value chain particularly technical textiles and manmade fibers, backward integration, increase in exports thereby resulting in overall development of the textile sector in the state.
data.objective: The main objective of the scheme is to attract investments and generate employment in the State’s textile sector across its value chain.
data.description:
The scheme provides reimbursement to adopt fire insurance:

  1. Reimbursement: 75% of insurance premium.
  2. Limit: Up to Rs. 5 lakh per year in ‘B’ category blocks.
  3. Limit: Up to Rs. 10 lakh per year in ‘C’ and ‘D’ category blocks.
data.how_to_apply:
Submit application on prescribed form (Annexure - I) for fire insurance assistance and required documents as mentioned in the form through the web portal of the Directorate of MSME within 3 months from the date of obtaining fire insurance or from the date of scheme notification, whichever is later.
Annexure-I : https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s3f48c04ffab49ff0e5d1176244fdfb65c/uploads/2023/07/2023070682.pdf
data.funding_facilitator: Director General, Directorate of MSME of Haryana
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned auhtority.
data.checklist_info_a:
Application in the prescribed format (Annexure – 1).
Detailed project report (Annexure-9).
Final Sanction letter of term loan.
Appraisal report from Bank/Financial Institution.
Certificate of incorporation/ registration of the organization, Memorandum and Articles of Association and Bye laws of the society (If applicable)/partnership deed etc.
Annual reports and Audited Statement of Accounts of last 3 years.
Blueprint/ Building Plan.
Land title documents for at least 15 years in case of MSME and Large units and at least 20 years in case of Anchor Units.
Change in Land Use (CLU)/ NOC permission for the project for said land from Competent Authority.
CA certificate regarding the proposed project cost and means of finance.
Chartered Engineer Certificate (Civil)
Chartered Engineer Certificate (Mechanical).
A declaration to the effect: “that the organization has not obtained/applied or will not obtain any grant/subsidy from any Ministry/Department of Central Govt./State GoI organization/agencies for the same purpose/ activity/same components”.
Latest Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). Aditionally URC for MSMEs and Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM) for Large and Anchor Units.
Documents in support of net-worth of the promoter in case of Anchor units.
Document in support of women/SC led enterprises/ enterprises coming up in textile related cluster in respective PADMA block.
Quotations for plant & machinery and equipments. Certificate from Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer for second-hand machines.

For 1st Instalment: 
Duly notarized Surety Bond {Annexure 2}
Duty notarized Affidavit {Annexure-3}
Chartered Accountant Certificate (For 50% utilization) {Annexure 4}
Bank Certificate certifying that they have released 50% of term loan. {Annexure 5}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Civil) {Annexure 6}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) for Plant & Machinery {Annexure 7}. certificate from CE (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer for second-hand machines.
Documents mentioned in the approval letter.
Bank Statement and Term Loan Statement showing payment made to suppliers/vendors.
Copy of invoices/receipts from the suppliers/vendors.
Compliance of conditions imposed in the approval letter of the grant-in-aid, if any.
Physical Site inspection report by inspection committee under the chairmanship of Additional Director, MSME.

For 2nd Instalment: 
Chartered Accountant Certificate (For 50% utilization) {Annexure 4}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Civil) {Annexure 6} 
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) {Annexure 7}. Certificate from Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer in case of second-hand machinery.
Utilization Certificate (CA-Certified) and countersigned by the promoter of the beneficiary company. {Annexure 8} 
Bank Certificate certifying that they have released 100% of term loan. {Annexure 5} 
Bank Statement and Term Loan Statement showing payment made to suppliers/vendors. 
Copy of invoices/receipts from the suppliers/vendors.
Compliance of conditions imposed in the approval letter of the grant-in-aid, if any.
Physical Site inspection report by inspection committee under the chairmanship of Additional Director, MSME.
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: Plot No. C-3, HSVP Complex, Sector 6, Panchkula – 134109
Phone: 0172-2580707
Email ID: info-msme@hry.gov.in
data.beneficiary: Textile Industry - All Entities - Haryana - All MSMEs
